oai_dc:dc.dc:title: List of officers and enlisted men of Company G, inside the lines
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Registers, lists, etc.; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: List of officers and enlisted men of a Confederate Company G "inside the lines." Includes fifty-three names listed for duty (nine of whom are listed as "sick"), seven listed in the convalescent camp, seven on daily duty, and one on detached service.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America -- War Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This list shows the number of men available for duty in the company. More importantly, it shows the high percentage of people sick or otherwise unavailable for active duty. The only soldier on detached duty is the brigade butcher, whose responsibilities likely kept him from active duty with his company.
